newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus doctors head to Albania on aid mission.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus doctors head to Albania on aid mission.

text.p: Two Cypriot surgeons said they would travel to Albania on Sunday with medical supplies to offer aid to the wounded in the rebel-held town of Sarande.

"There is a great need for antibiotics, bandages, gauzes, syringes and antiseptics to use in theatre," said Eleni Theocharous, head of the Cyprus section of Doctors of the World which is organising the visit.
"These supplies were purchased by Doctors of the World but we have asked the (Cypriot) government and the public to make donations and we expect more aid to follow," she told Reuters.
Theocharous and Andreas Neofytou, both pediatric surgeons in Cyprus's capital Nicosia, will work at the hospital of the southern port town for at least eight days.

Earlier on Saturday hospital doctors in Sarande, seized by rebels defying President Sali Berisha, said they were on a high alert for injuries in case of an army offensive. The hospital is running short of blood, plasma, gauzes and stitches.
